biotools.summary: An open-source algorithm for predicting C-terminal antigen processing for MHC-I and MHC-II. NetCleave maps reported IEDB peptides to protein sequences in UniProt/UniParc. After the identification of the C-terminal cleavage site, amino acid sequences are coded using QSAR descriptors, including steric, electrostatic and hydrophobic properties. Finally, a neural network architecture is used to generate the predictive model.

bioschemas.name: NetCleave
